source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: The corrosion of Zircaloy-4 is accelerated in water or steam above about 350°C when LiOH is present in sufficient concentrations.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: A short-term test (16 h) to predict inreactor corrosion behavior has been developed based on this accelerated corrosion.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: A group of claddings with a range of in-reactor corrosion behavior has been tested in LiOH solutions from 310 to 415°C with Li concentrations up to 375 ppm.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: A group of claddings with a range of in-reactor corrosion behavior has been tested in LiOH solutions from 310 to 415°C with Li concentrations up to 375 ppm.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Up to 100 times the rate seen in pure water was obtained in supercritical water with high LiOH levels.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: The best correlation to the in-reactor behavior was obtained for a Li content in the range of 75 to 190 ppm in the temperature range of 390 to 410°C.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: The best correlation to the in-reactor behavior was obtained for a Li content in the range of 75 to 190 ppm in the temperature range of 390 to 410°C.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: The corrosion rate for Zircaloy-4 in steam containing LiOH has been observed to be higher than in water with LiOH for tests below the critical temperature.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: For tests above the critical temperature, the corrosion rate was greater for samples which were above the initial water line in the capsule.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: The accelerated test with LiOH correlated well with 415°C/3 day autoclave test results for Zircaloy-4 but not for zirconium-based alloys containing niobium.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: The accelerated test with LiOH correlated well with 415°C/3 day autoclave test results for Zircaloy-4 but not for zirconium-based alloys containing niobium.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Kass [1] measured the corrosion and hydrogen pickup of Zircaloy-2 in concentrated LiOH solutions at 315 and 360°C.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Kass [1] measured the corrosion and hydrogen pickup of Zircaloy-2 in concentrated LiOH solutions at 315 and 360°C.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: He obtained very high corrosion rates with 0.1 to 1.0 N LiOH.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Also, the hydrogen pickup fraction, which is the ratio of the hydrogen absorbed by the sample to the amount of hydrogen liberated from the water during oxidation, was very high (generally about 60%).

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Murgatroyd and Winton [2] found the corrosion rate of Zircaloy-2 to increase significantly at 300°C in LiOH solutions.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Compared to the corrosion rate of pure water, the rate was increased by a factor of two with 5 g/L LiOH and a factor of 100 with 72 g/L.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk1
evidence_span: Compared to the corrosion rate of pure water, the rate was increased by a factor of two with 5 g/L LiOH and a factor of 100 with 72 g/L.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: Manolescu et al. [9] have compared the acceleration effect of LiOH on Zircaloy-2 and $Z \mathrm { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathrm { N b }$ for $0 . 0 0 0 5M$ to $1 M$ LiOH solutions.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: Manolescu et al. [9] have compared the acceleration effect of LiOH on Zircaloy-2 and $Z \mathrm { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathrm { N b }$ for $0 . 0 0 0 5M$ to $1 M$ LiOH solutions.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: They found that the acceleration was greater for the $\mathsf { Z r } ^ { - 2 . 5 \mathsf { N b } }$ alloy

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: the pickup of the hydrogen liberated during corrosion was much less for this alloy.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: The $\mathsf { Z r } \mathsf { - } 2 . 5 \mathsf { N b }$ alloy had a much more porous white oxide.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: They observed in loop tests at Cirene that an increase in LiOH from 2.2 to $1 0 \ \mathrm { p p m }$ caused a large increase in the corrosion rate if the void fraction is sufficiently high (greater than about $6 \%$ ).

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: The corrosion tests were performed in small Inconel capsules with volumes of 30 or $7 0 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ which were suspended in a vertical resistance tube furnace.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: This allowed for rapid heat up (about $4 5 ~ \mathrm { { m i n } }$ from room temperature) and cool down (water quenched).

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_037_chunk2
evidence_span: The surface area of the samples was about $1 \ \mathrm { c m } ^ { 2 }$ .
